intro: Lithospermum purpureum, commonly known as purple rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a small, capsule-like structure containing numerous seeds. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
